title: Constant polynomial matrices
content: A _constant polynomial matrix_ is a polynomial matrix whose elements are constant polynomials, i.e. polynomials with no indeterminates. Constant polynomials are obtained by "lifting" a "scalar" (i.e. an element of the underlying ring) into the polynomial ring/algebra by a "scalar injection", i.e. applying the "algebra scalar injection function" ` algSc ` (see ~ df-ascl ) to a scalar ` A e. R `: ` ( ( algSc `` P ) `` A ) ` . In an analogous way, constant polynomial matrices (over the ring ` R `) are obtained by "lifting" matrices over the ring ` R ` by the function ` matToPolyMat ` (see ~ df-mat2pmat ), called "matrix transformation" in the following. In this section it is shown that the set ` S = ( N ConstPolyMat R ) ` of constant polynomial ` N ` x ` N ` matrices over the ring ` R ` is a subring of the ring of polynomial ` N ` x ` N ` matrices over the ring ` R ` ( ~ cpmatsrgpmat ) and that ` T = ( N matToPolyMat R ) ` is a ring isomorphism between the ring of matrices over a ring ` R ` and the ring of constant polynomial matrices over the ring ` R ` (see ~ m2cpmrngiso ). By this, it is shown that the ring of matrices over a commutative ring is isomorphic to the ring of scalar matrices over the same ring, see ~ matcpmric . Finally ` I = ( N cPolyMatToMat R ) ` , the transformation of a constant polynomial matrix into a matrix, is the inverse function of the matrix transformation ` T = ( N matToPolyMat R ) ` , see ~ m2cpminv .

blocks.content: The set of all constant polynomial matrices, which are all matrices whose entries are constant polynomials (or "scalar polynomials", see ~ ply1sclf ). (Contributed by AV, 15-Nov-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-cpmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(ccpmat, cmpo(s0, s1, cfn, universe, crab(s2, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s0), cmat, cfv(cpl1, cv(s1)))), wral(s3, cv(s0), wral(s4, cv(s0), wral(s5, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(s3), cv(s2), cv(s4))), cv(s5)), cfv(c0g, cv(s1)))))))))
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-cpmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  ‚ä¢ ConstPolyMat =(s0 ‚àà Fin, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s2 ‚àà(Base `(s0[Mat](Poly1 ` s1)))| ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà s0, ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s0, ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s3[s2]s4))` s5)=(0 ` s1))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: df-mat2pmat
blocks.content: Transformation of a matrix (over a ring) into a matrix over the corresponding polynomial ring. (Contributed by AV, 31-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-mat2pmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cmat2pmat, cmpo(s0, s1, cfn, universe, cmpt(s2, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s0), cmat, cv(s1))), cmpo(s3, s4, cv(s0), cv(s0), cfv(cfv(cascl, cfv(cpl1, cv(s1))), co(cv(s3), cv(s2), cv(s4)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-mat2pmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ matToPolyMat =(s0 ‚àà Fin, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà(Base `(s0[Mat]s1))‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà s0, s4 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶((algSc `(Poly1 ` s1))`(s3[s2]s4)))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: df-cpmat2mat
blocks.content: Transformation of a constant polynomial matrix (over a ring) into a matrix over the corresponding ring. Since this function is the inverse function of ` matToPolyMat ` , see ~ m2cpminv , it is also called "inverse matrix transformation" in the following. (Contributed by AV, 14-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-cpmat2mat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(ccpmat2mat, cmpo(s0, s1, cfn, universe, cmpt(s2, co(cv(s0), ccpmat, cv(s1)), cmpo(s3, s4, cv(s0), cv(s0), cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(s3), cv(s2), cv(s4))), nat0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-cpmat2mat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ cPolyMatToMat =(s0 ‚àà Fin, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà(s0[ConstPolyMat]s1)‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà s0, s4 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶((coe1 `(s3[s2]s4))` 0))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: cpmat
blocks.content: Value of the constructor of the set of all constant polynomial matrices, i.e. the set of all ` N ` x ` N ` matrices of polynomials over a ring ` R ` . (Contributed by AV, 15-Nov-2019.)

blocks.pretty:
thm cpmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí c3 = { s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s1[s0]s2))` s3)=(0 ` c1))))})
  ‚ä£ c3 =(c0[ConstPolyMat]c1)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Poly1 ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(c0[Mat]c5)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, c1)
} = {
  syl5eq(c3, { s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s1[s0]s2))` s3)=(0 ` c1))))}, (c0[ConstPolyMat]c1), (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  ovmpt2d(hs0, hs1, c0, ccpmat, c1, { s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s1[s0]s2))` s3)=(0 ` c1))))}, cfn, universe, { s0 ‚àà(Base `(hs0[Mat](Poly1 ` hs1)))| ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s1[s0]s2))` s3)=(0 ` hs1))))}, universe, (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  a1i((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), ConstPolyMat =(hs0 ‚àà Fin, hs1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s0 ‚àà(Base `(hs0[Mat](Poly1 ` hs1)))| ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s1[s0]s2))` s3)=(0 ` hs1))))}))

thm cpmatel2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wcel(c2, c4), wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wrex(s2, c5, wceq(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cfv(c6, cv(s2))))))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c0, ccpmat, c1))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cpl1, c1))
  -| wceq(c8, co(c0, cmat, c7))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c8))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cascl, c7))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
  -| diffsc(s2, c7)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wcel(c2, c4), wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wrex(s2, c5, wceq(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cfv(c6, cv(s2)))))))), diffsc(s2, c0))
  bitrd(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c2, c4), wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wrex(s2, c5, wceq(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cfv(c6, cv(s2)))))), wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1))))))
  cpmatel(s0, s1, hs0, c0, c1, crg, c2, c3, c4, c7, c8)
  2ralbidva(s0, s1, c0, c0, w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1))), wrex(s2, c5, wceq(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cfv(c6, cv(s2)))))
  bicomd(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0))), wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1))), wrex(s2, c5, wceq(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cfv(c6, cv(s2)))))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0))), wb(wrex(s2, c5, wceq(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cfv(c6, cv(s2)))), wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1)))), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cfv(cbs, c7)))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)))
  matecld(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1), cfv(cbs, c7), c8, c0, c7, c3, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0))))
  simprl(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  simprr(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)))
  cply1coe0bi(s2, hs0, c1, co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cfv(cbs, c7), c5, c6, cfv(c0g, c1), c7)
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c7))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.w3a.s(s0, wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfn)
  diff.cfn.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, crg)
  diff.crg.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c2, c3)
  diff.w3a.s(s1, wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c2, c3))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, cfn)
  diff.cfn.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c1, crg)
  diff.crg.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c2, c3)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.co.s(s2, cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, cbs, c7)
  diff.cbs.s(s2)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, c0g, c1)
  diff.c0g.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.c(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c7))
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.c(c6)
}

thm cpmatel2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí(c2 ‚àà c4 ‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà c5,(s0[c2]s1)=(c6 ` s2))))))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(c0[ConstPolyMat]c1)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(Poly1 ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c8 =(c0[Mat]c7)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c8)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Base ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(algSc ` c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)

  ‚ä£ d(s2, c5)

  ‚ä£ d(s2, c7)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí(c2 ‚àà c4 ‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà c5,(s0[c2]s1)=(c6 ` s2)))))), d(s2, c0))
  bitrd((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), c2 ‚àà c4, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà c5,(s0[c2]s1)=(c6 ` s2)))), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s0[c2]s1))` hs0)=(0 ` c1)))))
  cpmatel(s0, s1, hs0, c0, c1, crg, c2, c3, c4, c7, c8)
  2ralbidva(s0, s1, c0, c0, (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s0[c2]s1))` hs0)=(0 ` c1)), ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà c5,(s0[c2]s1)=(c6 ` s2)))
  bicomd(((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚àß(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0)), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s0[c2]s1))` hs0)=(0 ` c1)), ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà c5,(s0[c2]s1)=(c6 ` s2)))
  syl2anc(((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚àß(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0)), (‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà c5,(s0[c2]s1)=(c6 ` s2))‚Üî ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((coe1 `(s0[c2]s1))` hs0)=(0 ` c1))), c1 ‚àà Ring, (s0[c2]s1)‚àà(Base ` c7))
  simpl2(c0 ‚àà Fin, c1 ‚àà Ring, c2 ‚àà c3, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0))
  matecld(s0, c2, s1, (Base ` c7), c8, c0, c7, c3, ((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚àß(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0)))
  simprl((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), s0 ‚àà c0, s1 ‚àà c0)
  simprr((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), s0 ‚àà c0, s1 ‚àà c0)
  simpl3(c0 ‚àà Fin, c1 ‚àà Ring, c2 ‚àà c3, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0))
  cply1coe0bi(s2, hs0, c1, (s0[c2]s1), (Base ` c7), c5, c6, (0 ` c1), c7)
  eqid((0 ` c1))

  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfn)

  diff.hs0.c(c6)
}

blocks.name: cpmatacl
blocks.content: The set of all constant polynomial matrices over a ring ` R ` is closed under addition. (Contributed by AV, 17-Nov-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 28-Nov-2019.)

blocks.name: cpmatinvcl

blocks.name: cpmatmcl
blocks.content: The set of all constant polynomial matrices over a ring ` R ` is closed under multiplication. (Contributed by AV, 18-Nov-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm cpmatmcl(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wral(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wcel(co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(s1)), c2))))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c0, ccpmat, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cpl1, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c0, cmat, c4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  ralrimivva(s0, s1, c2, c2, wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(s1)), c2))
  mpbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2))), wcel(co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(s1)), c2), wral(hs1, c0, wral(hs2, c0, wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(s1)), cv(hs2))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1))))))
  mpbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2))), wral(hs1, c0, wral(hs2, c0, wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(s1)), cv(hs2))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1))))), wral(hs1, c0, wral(hs2, c0, wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(c4, cgsu, cmpt(hs3, c0, co(co(cv(hs1), cv(s0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs3), cv(s1), cv(hs2)))))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1))))))
  cpmatmcllem(s0, s1, hs1, hs2, hs0, hs3, c0, c1, c2, c4, c3)
  ralbidva(hs1, c0, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2))), wral(hs2, c0, wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(s1)), cv(hs2))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1)))), wral(hs2, c0, wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(c4, cgsu, cmpt(hs3, c0, co(co(cv(hs1), cv(s0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs3), cv(s1), cv(hs2)))))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1)))))
  ralbidva(hs2, c0, wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(s1)), cv(hs2))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1))), wral(hs0, cn, wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(c4, cgsu, cmpt(hs3, c0, co(co(cv(hs1), cv(s0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs3), cv(s1), cv(hs2)))))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1))))
  ralbidva(hs0, cn, wa(wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wcel(cv(hs2), c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(s1)), cv(hs2))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(c4, cgsu, cmpt(hs3, c0, co(co(cv(hs1), cv(s0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs3), cv(s1), cv(hs2)))))), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, c1)))

blocks.name: mat2pmatghm
blocks.content: The transformation of matrices into polynomial matrices is an additive group homomorphism. (Contributed by AV, 28-Oct-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 28-Nov-2019.)

blocks.name: mat2pmatmul
blocks.content: The transformation of matrices into polynomial matrices preserves the multiplication. (Contributed by AV, 29-Oct-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 28-Nov-2019.)

blocks.name: mat2pmatlin
blocks.content: The transformation of matrices into polynomial matrices is "linear", analogous to ~ lmhmlin . Since ` A ` and ` C ` have different scalar rings, ` T ` cannot be a left module homomorphism as defined in ~ df-lmhm , see ~ lmhmsca . (Contributed by AV, 13-Nov-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 28-Nov-2019.)

blocks.name: 0mat2pmat
blocks.content: The transformed zero matrix is the zero polynomial matrix. (Contributed by AV, 5-Aug-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 19-Nov-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm 0mat2pmat(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfn)), wceq(cfv(c2, c3), c4))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c1, cmat2pmat, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cpl1, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(c0g, co(c1, cmat, c0)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(c0g, co(c1, cmat, c5)))
} = {
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfn)), wceq(cfv(c2, c3), c4), wcel(c2, co(co(c1, cmat, c0), cghm, co(c1, cmat, c5))))
  ancoms(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, co(co(c1, cmat, c0), cghm, co(c1, cmat, c5))))
  mat2pmatghm(c1, c0, c2, co(c1, cmat, c0), co(c1, cmat, c5), cfv(cbs, co(c1, cmat, c0)), c5, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cmat, c5)))
  eqid(co(c1, cmat, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c1, cmat, c0)))
  eqid(co(c1, cmat, c5))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c1, cmat, c5)))
  ghmid(c2, co(c1, cmat, c0), co(c1, cmat, c5), c3, c4)
}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c1 ‚àà Fin)‚Üí(c2 ` c3)= c4)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(c1[matToPolyMat]c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Poly1 ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(0 `(c1[Mat]c0))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(0 `(c1[Mat]c5))
} = {

  ancoms(c0 ‚àà Ring, c1 ‚àà Fin, c2 ‚àà((c1[Mat]c0)[GrpHom](c1[Mat]c5)))
  mat2pmatghm(c1, c0, c2, (c1[Mat]c0), (c1[Mat]c5), (Base `(c1[Mat]c0)), c5, (Base `(c1[Mat]c5)))
  eqid((c1[Mat]c0))

  eqid((c1[Mat]c5))

thm idmatidpmat(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

  3eqtr4g(cfv(c2, c3), c4, cfv(c2, cfv(cur, co(c1, cmat, c0))), cfv(cur, co(c1, cmat, c5)), wa(wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c0, crg)))
  mat2pmat1(c1, c0, c2, co(c1, cmat, c0), co(c1, cmat, c5), cfv(cbs, co(c1, cmat, c0)), c5, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cmat, c5)))

  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c1, cmat, c5)))

} = {
  fmpt2d(hs0, hs1, c2, c3, c4, cmpo(hs2, hs3, c0, c0, cfv(cfv(cascl, cfv(cpl1, c1)), co(cv(hs2), cv(hs0), cv(hs3)))), universe, wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))

  jca(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c0, cfn))

  mat2pmatfval(hs0, hs2, hs3, c0, c1, crg, c2, c3, cfv(cascl, cfv(cpl1, c1)), c5, cfv(cpl1, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cpl1, c1))

blocks.name: cpm2mf
blocks.content: The inverse matrix transformation is a function from the constant polynomial matrices to the matrices over the base ring of the polynomials. (Contributed by AV, 24-Nov-2019.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)

thm cpm2mf(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wf(c2, c3, c4))

} = {
  fmpt3d(hs0, c2, c3, c4, cmpo(hs1, hs2, c0, c0, cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), cv(hs2))), nat0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))

  matbas2d(hs1, hs2, c0, cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), cv(hs2))), nat0), c4, c5, c1, cfv(cbs, c1), crg, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  simpll(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(cv(hs0), c3))
  simplr(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(cv(hs0), c3))
  sylancl(w3a(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs2), c0)), wcel(cfv(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), cv(hs2))), nat0), cfv(cbs, c1)), wcel(co(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cpl1, c1))), wcel(nat0, cn0))
  matecld(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), cv(hs2), cfv(cbs, cfv(cpl1, c1)), co(c0, cmat, cfv(cpl1, c1)), c0, cfv(cpl1, c1), cfv(cbs, co(c0, cmat, cfv(cpl1, c1))), w3a(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs2), c0)))
  simp2(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs2), c0))
  simp3(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs2), c0))
  3ad2ant1(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs2), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, co(c0, cmat, cfv(cpl1, c1)))))
  3expa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, co(c0, cmat, cfv(cpl1, c1)))))
  cpmatpmat(c0, c1, crg, cv(hs0), c3, cfv(cbs, co(c0, cmat, cfv(cpl1, c1))), cfv(cpl1, c1), co(c0, cmat, cfv(cpl1, c1)))
  eqid(co(c0, cmat, cfv(cpl1, c1)))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c0, cmat, cfv(cpl1, c1))))
  0nn0()
  coe1fvalcl(co(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cpl1, c1)), nat0, cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), cv(hs2))), cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cpl1, c1), c1)
  eqid(cfv(cco1, co(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(cpl1, c1)))
  eqid(cfv(cpl1, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)

  matecld(hs1, hs0, hs2, (Base `(Poly1 ` c1)), (c0[Mat](Poly1 ` c1)), c0, (Poly1 ` c1), (Base `(c0[Mat](Poly1 ` c1))), (((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring)‚àß hs0 ‚àà c3)‚àß hs1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß hs2 ‚àà c0))

  0nn0()
  coe1fvalcl((hs1[hs0]hs2), (Base `(Poly1 ` c1)), nat0, (coe1 `(hs1[hs0]hs2)), (Base ` c1), (Poly1 ` c1), c1)
  eqid((coe1 `(hs1[hs0]hs2)))
  eqid((Base `(Poly1 ` c1)))
  eqid((Poly1 ` c1))
  eqid((Base ` c1))

blocks.name: m2cpminvid

blocks.name: m2cpmfo
blocks.content: The matrix transformation is a function from the matrices onto the constant polynomial matrices. (Contributed by AV, 19-Nov-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 28-Nov-2019.)

  jca(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wf1o(c2, c3, c4), wceq(ccnv(c2), c5))

  2fvidinvd(hs0, hs1, c2, c5, c3, c4, wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))
  cpm2mf(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c6)
  m2cpmf(c0, c1, c5, c4, c3, c6)
  ralrimiva(hs0, c3, wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wceq(cfv(c5, cfv(c2, cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  3expa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wceq(cfv(c5, cfv(c2, cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  m2cpminvid2(c0, c1, cv(hs0), c3, c5, c2)
  ralrimiva(hs1, c4, wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wceq(cfv(c2, cfv(c5, cv(hs1))), cv(hs1)))
  3expa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(cv(hs1), c4), wceq(cfv(c2, cfv(c5, cv(hs1))), cv(hs1)))
  m2cpminvid(c0, c1, cv(hs1), c4, c2, c5, c6)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))
  diff.hs1.w(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))
}

blocks.name: m2cpminv0
blocks.content: The inverse matrix transformation applied to the zero polynomial matrix results in the zero of the matrices over the base ring of the polynomials. (Contributed by AV, 24-Nov-2019.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)

thm m2cpminv0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wceq(cfv(c2, c3), c4))

  -| wceq(c7, co(c0, cmat, c6))

  -| wceq(c3, cfv(c0g, c7))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(c2, c3), c4, cfv(c2, cfv(co(c0, cmat2pmat, c1), c4)), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))
  fveq2d(c2, c3, cfv(co(c0, cmat2pmat, c1), c4), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))

  ancoms(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wceq(cfv(co(c0, cmat2pmat, c1), c4), c3))
  0mat2pmat(c1, c0, co(c0, cmat2pmat, c1), c4, c3, c6)
  eqtri(c4, cfv(c0g, co(c0, cmat, c1)), cfv(c0g, c5))
  fveq2i(c0g, c5, co(c0, cmat, c1))
  eqtri(c3, cfv(c0g, co(c0, cmat, c6)), cfv(c0g, c7))
  fveq2i(c0g, c7, co(c0, cmat, c6))
  mpd3an3(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg), wceq(cfv(c2, cfv(co(c0, cmat2pmat, c1), c4)), c4), wcel(c4, cfv(cbs, c5)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c4, cfv(cbs, c5)), wcel(c5, crg))
